Nafiz azam bahagiakan ibu
01 Nov 2019, 05:20 by Oleh Mohd Helmi Irwadi Mohd Nor
MUHD Nafiz Muaz Mat Nasir, 21 atau Nafiz Muaz tak kisah jika tidak meraih sebarang anugerah dalam dunia lakonan sebaliknya mahu ‘memenangi’ hati ibunya.
Anak sulung daripada lima beradik ini berkata, wanita hebat bernama Naimah Baharuddin, 39, adalah individu penting membuatkan dirinya bergelar pelakon.
Menurut Nafiz , selepas kematian bapa, Mat Nasir Desa, 40, akibat demam panas pada 2014, mereka sekeluarga melalui kehidupan yang sukar.
“Ketika itu saya berusia 16 tahun dan mempunyai empat adik yang masih kecil. Ibu berkorban segala-galanya membesarkan kami dengan bekerja kilang di Taman Kempas, Sungai Petani, Kedah,” katanya.
Terdahulu, katanya, bapanya yang juga peniaga char kuetiau menguruskan keluarga, namun selepas meninggal dunia mereka bagai hilang punca.
“Saya nampak raut wajah ibu yang keletihan dan berazam membantunya. Masakan tidak, sudah 22 tahun ibu bekerja kilang dan tidak menikmati zaman muda,” katanya pada sesi fotografi bersama Harian Metro di Studio The New Straits Times (M) Berhad, Kuala Lumpur, semalam.
Kata Nafiz, kesukaran itu memaksanya menyertai Drama Festival Kuala Lumpur (DFKL) pada 2016 dan bersyukur layak mara ke peringkat akhir.
Biarpun ketika itu dia meraih 4A dalam Sijil Pelajaran Malaysia (SPM) selain menerima tawaran menyambung pengajian di universiti, Nafiz terpaksa melupakan hasrat itu bagi membantu keluarga.
“Inilah realiti kehidupan dan saya perlu memikul tanggungjawab sebagai ketua keluarga. Alhamdulillah, dengan rezeki yang ada saya mahu membahagiakan ibu dan adik,” katanya.
Selain Nafiz, adik lelakinya yang berusia 19 tahun direkrut sebagai anggota polis di Pusat Latihan Polis (Pulapol) di Kuala Lumpur.


NAFIZ perlu pikul tanggungjawab sebagai ketua keluarga untuk sara ibu dan adik. FOTO: Mahzir Mat Isa

Apabila berada dalam industri hiburan, Nafiz mahu mengelak sebarang kontroversi yang akan memalukan keluarga selain sentiasa ingat asal usulnya.
“Jika ada masa terluang, saya akan pulang ke kampung untuk menjenguk keluarga. Apabila bertemu rakan, saya tidak akan meletakkan diri sebagai selebriti,” katanya yang gemar menunggang motosikal dan bermain futsal.
Memandangkan dirinya pelajar ‘nakal’ sebelum ini, bekas pelajar Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan (SMK) Sungai Pasir ini akan menemui semua gurunya untuk meminta maaf malah mereka turut berbangga dengan pencapaiannya.
Pelakon utama Cinta Belum Tamat tempoh ini turut berazam menjadi pelakon serba boleh, berdisiplin dan memiliki kesungguhan dalam bekerja.
“Sepanjang tiga tahun menjadi pelakon, saya dapat membezakan baik buruk dan menjaga diri. Artis manusia biasa, ada masanya kami letih dan mahu bersendirian.
“Jika bertemu peminat, kami perlu mengekalkan senyuman dan menjaga tingkah laku sepanjang masa,” katanya yang setakat ini sudah membintangi 19 drama dan telefilem antaranya Budak Boys, Cinta Tiada Ganti, Hilang Yang Kembali, Terima Kasih Ibu serta Hijrah Itu Indah.
Menyedari teknologi berkembang pesat, Nafiz turut berhati-hati dengan media sosial terutama isu tular membabitkan selebriti tanah air.
“Saya dapati ramai menyalahgunakan media sosial. Pantang ada peluang, mereka akan cari kesalahan orang lain. Disebabkan itu saya tidak berkongsi kehidupan peribadi dengan orang ramai,” katanya.
Berkongsi pengalamannya, Nafiz memberitahu seorang wanita mengirimkan mesej di Instagram (IG) untuk mengetahui siapa teman wanitanya baru-baru ini selain pernah dihamburkan kata-kata kesat.
“Dalam pada berhati-hati pun orang masih cari fasal. Saya pula tak suka serabutkan fikiran, jadi lebih baik mengelak dan hanya fokus pada karier,” katanya.
Menyentuh perkembangan terkini, Nafiz kini menjalani penggambaran drama romantik komedi berjudul Cik Propa vs Cik Perampas.
Menerusi drama 20 episod yang memulakan penggambaran pada 20 September lalu itu, dia memegang watak utama.
Selain itu, Nafiz teruja apabila drama lakonannya, Terima Kasih Ibu layak bertanding Anugerah Skrin pada tahun ini. Drama itu turut dibintangi Azhan Rani, Nad Zainal dan Adam Corie.
“Saya puas berlakon dalam drama ini kerana dapat bergandingan dengan ramai pelakon hebat.
“Azhan Rani, Nad dan Adam Corie pula tidak lokek ilmu terutama bagaimana mahu menjiwai watak dengan berkesan,” katanya yang menjadikan Bront Palarae sebagai idola.

Nafiz is determined to make mom happy
01 Nov 2019, 05:20 by Mohd Helmi Irwadi Mohd Nor
MUHD Nafiz Muaz Mat Nasir, 21 or Nafiz Muaz don't care if they don't win any awards in the acting world but want to 'win' their mother's heart.
The eldest of the five siblings said a wonderful woman named Naimah Baharuddin, 39, was an important person to make herself an actress.
According to Nafiz, after the death of his father, Mat Nasir Desa, 40, due to a fever in 2014, they had a difficult family life.
“At the time I was 16 and had four younger children. Mother sacrificed everything to raise us by working at the Kempas Park, Sungai Petani, Kedah, ”he said.
Earlier, he said, his father, who is also a quake trader, managed the family, but after his death they lost their cause.
“I saw the look on her tired face and determined to help her. No, no, it's been 22 years since she worked in the factory and didn't enjoy her youth, "she said during a photo session with Daily Metro at The New Straits Times (M) Berhad Studio in Kuala Lumpur, yesterday.
According to Nafiz, the hardship forced her to attend the Kuala Lumpur Drama Festival (DFKL) in 2016 and was grateful to be in the finals.
Although at the time she was earning a 4A in Certificate of Education Malaysia (SPM) besides accepting an offer to continue her studies at university, Nafiz had to give up on her desire to help her family.
“This is the reality of life and I have to take on the responsibility of being the head of the family. Thank God, with the provision I have, I want to make my mother and sister happy, ”she said.
Besides Nafiz, her 19-year-old brother was recruited as a police officer at the Police Training Center (Pulapol) in Kuala Lumpur.


NAFIZ needs to take on the responsibility of being the head of the family for the mother and sister. PHOTOS: Mahzir Mat Isa

When it comes to the entertainment industry, Nafiz wants to avoid any controversy that would embarrass the family and always remember its origins.
"If I have free time, I will go back to the village to visit my family. When I meet a friend, I will not be a celebrity, ”he said, who loves riding a motorcycle and playing futsal.
Given her previous 'naughty' students, this former Sungai Pasir National High School (SMK) student would find all her teachers to apologize and even be proud of her achievement.
The lead actor of Love Never Ends this season is also determined to be a versatile, disciplined and passionate actress.
“During my three years as an actor, I have been able to distinguish between good and bad. Ordinary human artists, sometimes we get tired and want to be alone.
"When it comes to meeting fans, we have to keep smiling and keep an eye on all the time," he said, so far starring in 19 dramas and televisions including Boys, Love Without Change, Missing Return, Mother's Love and Beautiful Scroll.
Recognizing the growing technology, Nafiz is also wary of social media, especially on the issue of celebrity celebrity.
"I find that many people use social media. Whenever there is a chance, they will look for someone else's fault. That's why I don't share my personal life with the public, ”he said.
Sharing her experience, Nafiz told a woman she posted on Instagram (IG) to find out who her boyfriend was recently and had been verbally abusive.
“At least people are still looking for clauses. I don't like to overdo it, so it's better to avoid and just focus on my career, ”he said.
Touching on the latest developments, Nafiz is currently filming a romantic comedy drama titled Ms. Propa vs Ms. Perampas.
In the 20-episode drama that began filming on September 20, he plays the lead character.
In addition, Nafiz was excited when her acting drama, Thank You Mother competed for this year's Screen Awards. The drama also starred Azhan Rani, Nad Zainal and Adam Corie.
“I am happy to be in this drama because I can compete with many great actors.
"Azhan Rani, Nad and Adam Corie are not very knowledgeable, especially in how they want to be successful characters," he said, making Bront Palarae an idol.
